profile_positions.description:
I currently coordinate the Our Fish, Notre Poisson project, working together in a coalition of 9 member organisations across West Africa and Europe to tackle the fish meal and fish oil industry, which is destroying livelihoods and ecosystems in West Africa and beyond. 

My role revolves around project management and advocacy, with tasks such as:

• Day-to-day management and coordination, in liaison with the coalition partners to ensure the project (Our Fish, Notre Poisson) is run effectively and efficiently.
• Planning and assigning deliverables and activities, reviewing progress, and addressing deviations in terms of timelines and quality.
• Managing budgets.
• Producing grant reports and communicating with funders.
• Liaising with consultants regarding contracts and invoices.
• Building relationships with other civil society groups, policymakers and industry.
• Participating in European and global coalitions, networks, and conversations and leveraging these relationships to amplify research and campaigning.
• Formulating policy recommendations.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
At PUM, I held a double function. As Programme Coordinator, I was responsible for proper programme development throughout the organisation, supporting individual country teams on how to formulate programme plans and proposals, making sure they stay aligned with PUM’s strategy and mission. Apart from coordinating internally, I was also a focal point for external programme partners, fostering relations, co-developing consortium programmes, co-authoring proposals to donors, connecting the different stakeholders and assuring established processes are followed properly on PUM’s side.

As Project Officer within the country team for Mali and Burkina Faso, I administered and facilitated the proper execution of volunteer expert advice on location or remote advice to our clients. This included close collaboration with the Malian PUM representatives who scout for and ‘acquire’ clients, demands extensive knowledge about the country, its economy and culture, an eye for strategy and planning and a good grip on admin tasks such as arranging travel and visas or working in CRM systems and software such as Teams.

In addition to these two roles, I joined PUM’s efforts to promote diversity, inclusion and sustainability in all its facets throughout the organisation and to contribute to the development of strategic documents and processes (an improved structure for programmes, guiding documents for programme development, action plan formats, a new ToC, etc.)

"Yves' academic background in development studies, his command of 4 languages (German, Dutch, French and English), excellent writing skills, along with his investigative and curious mind, are some of his assets that make him extremely suitable to work in a management position in international development, not only at operational but also at planning, management and monitoring level." - C. Gerhardt, Country Coordinator at PUM
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator & Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
As Office Manager (maternity cover), I organize and host internal company meetings and events, manage various office suppliers, process staff expense claims and invoices, set up different employee benefits such as language and fitness courses, oversee and advise staff on business travel, provide ad hoc support for the People team and lead the company's health and safety activities.
At the core of my role is promoting a healthy work environment for all employees, while ensuring all safety measures and facilitating the smooth running of day to day business - all of which requires excellent organisational and multitasking and strong interpersonal skills.

“His commitment and open and easily approachable personality make him a fine colleague and team member who inspires a lot of confidence.” – Feedback from a close team member during a performance review.

profile_positions.description:
As Training Operations Facilitator in KPMG Luxembourg's learning and development department, I helped dozens of clients fruitfully attend diverse training courses and supported them in their learning journey by handling all administrative details of their training in the Learning Management System, liaising between them, their trainers and training providers or organizing department-wide conferences.

A cherished personal accomplishment was developing and holding a well received training-course on multicultural communication. Finally, always eager to learn about innovation in education, I endorsed the departments push towards new learning approaches (MOOCs or bite-sized learning modules) and volunteered to pioneer and implement them in the departments training offer.
